title: Teenage lesbian couple claim they were ‘forced’ to leave McDonald’s after cleaner told them their kissing ‘wasn’t appropriate’
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A TEEN lesbian couple claim they were booted out of a McDonald’s – after a cleaner told them kissing “wasn’t appropriate”. 
Kristeen Ferenczi, 16, said she felt forced to leave the fast food restaurant after she gave her 17-year-old girlfriend a peck on the cheek. MEN Media 3 Kristeen Ferenczi said she felt forced to leave the McDonald’s for kissing her girlfriend 
Both girls were left in floods of tears by the apparent “homophobia” and have complained to McDonald’s . 
The couple were in the Bolton branch with a family member on Thursday lunchtime when the cleaner approached them. 
Kristeen, who lives in Farnworth, told the M.E.N : “We were sitting down with my girlfriend and my girlfriend’s cousin having a meal. MEN Media 3 The teen and her girlfriend were left in tears by the alleged incident 
“When he got up to go I noticed this woman just lingering around us, and as I kissed my girlfriend on the cheek she came over and told us it wasn’t appropriate, and implied for us to leave. 
“I turned round and said ‘are you homophobic?’ but she wouldn’t answer. “When I rang the management to complain they said if it happens again they will talk to her, but it’s not good enough. We are not going to come back. 
“We have had people say things to us in the past but we have never had someone approach us and kick us out before. 
“It made us feel awful, we were walking out and we didn’t know what to do, so we just started crying. That’s all we felt we could do.” Alamy 3 McDonald’s said they were investigating 
The girls, who have been together for almost a year, regularly eat at the restaurant while they both attend Bolton Sixth Form College. 
A McDonald’s spokesman said: “We are extremely sorry for Ms Ferenczi and her partners’ experience and have taken this complaint very seriously. 
“An internal investigation is currently underway and we would like to make it clear that discrimination of this nature is wholly unacceptable and not, in any way, tolerated by McDonald’s.” Chaos at Stockport McDonald's as brutal brawl spreads into the kitchen
